name: Philippe Cudré-Mauroux
content: Philippe Cudré-Mauroux Full Professor AddressBd de Pérolles 901700 FribourgSwitzerland E-Mail [email protected] Phone+41 26 300 8332 Google Scholar Profile DBLP Computer Science Bibliography Philippe Cudré-Mauroux Brief Bio I'm a Full Professor at the University of Fribourg, Switzerland, where I lead the eXascale Infolab. Before coming back to Switzerland, I spent a few exciting years working with the Database Systems lab (Sam Madden & Mike Stonbraker) at MIT. I got my B.Sc. from EPFL, and two M.Sc., one from Eurecom and one from INRIA SOP/U. of Sofia-Antipolis. At the end of my studies, I spent six months at IBM T.J. Watson Research, working on media delivery architectures. I got my Ph.D. from EPFL, working in Karl Aberer's lab. My dissertation on data interoperability and emergent semantics won the school-wide EPFL Doctorate Award and the EPFL Press Mention in 2007. During my Ph.D., I also spent some time at U.C. Berkeley working on sensor data and at Microsoft Research Asia working on novel information-sharing systems. I recently won a 2M€ ERC Grant, a Google Faculty Research Award, as well as the VeriSign Internet Infrastructures Award. Research Interests Exascale Information Management Infrastructures for Big Data & AI Scientific Data Linked Data. Recent/Upcoming Events June 2024: ACM SIGMOD in Santiago [Panel Chair] March 2024: ACM WSDM in Mérida [Senior PC] October 2023: ACM CIKM in Birmingham [Senior PC] May 2023: ACM WWW in Austin [Senior PC] Recent Appointments 2021: Research Council Member (Responsible for Applied Computer Science), Swiss National Science Foundation 2021: Scientific Advisory Board Member, chist-era EU Research Programme 2016: Full Professor, University of Fribourg–Switzerland 2015-2016: Visiting Researcher, Microsoft CISL–USA 2015: Visiting Professor, MIT–USA 2015: Forum des 100–Switzerland 2011: President of the GITI–Switzerland 2011: Board of Directors, Swiss-Engineering–Switzerland 2010: Swiss NSF Professor, University of Fribourg–Switzerland Awards & Prizes 2020: Best Paper Award, Swiss Data Science Conference, Switzerland. 2020: Most Reproducible Paper Award, VLDB 2020, Japan. 2019: Best Paper Award, AAMAS 2019, Canada. 2016: ERC Consolidator Grant, European Research Council. 2013: Google Faculty Research Award, USA. 2012: Outstanding Contribution to Computer Science Award, Swiss National Center in Research MICS (link to the MICS event). 2012: Verisign Inc. Internet Infrastructures Award, USA. Press release here. 2011: Marie-Curie Career Integration Grant. 2011: Best Demo Award, ISWC, Germany. 2011: Outrageous Idea Award, Computing Community Consortium (CCC), Germany. 2011: Amazon AWS Teaching Grant, USA. 2010: SNSF Professorship, Swiss National Science Foundation, Switzerland. 2010: Best Mentor Award, International Semantic Web Conference, Shanghai–China. 2007: EPFL Doctorate Award (best EPFL thesis out of 292 Ph.D. theses), EPFL–Switzerland. 2007: EPFL Press Mention (for outstanding publication), EPFL, Switzerland. 2001: Best Student (out of 30 European students), M.Sc. program in Multimedia Communications, Eurecom Institute & EPFL.
